intro: Stoeberia carpii, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lanceolate, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Stoeberia carpii prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in rock gardens and alpine collections.
